==In the media== [[File:Tina Fey by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Fey at the 2010 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] promoting ''[[Megamind]]'']] In 2001, ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' named Fey as one of their Entertainers of the Year for her work on ''Weekend Update''.<ref name="Baldwin2001">{{cite news|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,252814,00.html|title=8 Tina Fey|last=Baldwin|first=Kristen|date=December 21, 2001|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=July 16, 2009}}</ref> In 2007, she was named one of the magazine's Entertainers of the Year,<ref name="Shaw">{{cite news |url= http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20152943_20153269_20161218_17,00.html|title=Entertainers of the Year: 25 Top Stars of 2007 |last=Shaw |first= Jessica |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref> and placed number two in 2008.<ref name="Armstrong2008">{{cite news |url= http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20240194,00.html|title=Tina Fey: Entertainer of the year|last=Armstrong|first=Jennifer|date=November 14, 2008|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref> In 2009, Fey was named as ''Entertainment Weekly''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s fifth individual in their 15 Entertainers of the 2000s list.<ref name="Armstrong">{{cite news|first=Jennifer|last=Armstrong|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/gallery/0,,20321301_20324236_5,00.html|title=Tina Fey – 15 Entertainers of the 2000s|accessdate=April 2, 2010|work=Entertainment Weekly}}</ref> In 2013, ''Entertainment Weekly'' crowned Fey as "The Once and Future Queen" (an allusion to ''[[The Once and Future King]]'') in their feature on "Women Who Run TV," calling her "the funniest woman in the free world." ''EW'' quoted [[Mindy Kaling]] as saying, "I always feel unoriginal bringing up Tina as my inspiration, but she's everyone's inspiration for a reason." The column also quoted praise by [[Zooey Deschanel]] and [[Lena Dunham]].<ref>{{cite journal |author= ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' Staff |title= More Women Who Run TV: Part 2: Overachievers. They Act! They Write! They Produce! They Rule! |journal= [[Entertainment Weekly]] |date= February 8, 2013 |location= New York |publisher= Time Inc. |page= 49}}</ref>
In 2002, Fey was ranked in the Hot 100 List at number 80 on ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'' magazine,<ref name="believerint">{{cite web|url=http://www.believermag.com/issues/200311/?read=interview_fey|title=Believer Interview with Tina Fey|last=Spitznagel|first=Eric|date=November 2003|work=[[The Believer (magazine)|The Believer]]|accessdate=November 17, 2007}}</ref> which used photos taken earlier by ''Rolling Stone'' calling her "the thinking man's sex symbol".<ref name="Yahoo_voices">{{cite web|url=http://voices.yahoo.com/ten-facts-tina-fey-hottest-geek-tv-75988.html|title=Ten Facts About Tina Fey, the Hottest Geek on TV|last=Leibowitz|first=Wanda|date=September 18, 2006|work=[[Yahoo|Yahoo Voices]]|accessdate=May 27, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729001126/http://voices.yahoo.com/ten-facts-tina-fey-hottest-geek-tv-75988.html|archivedate=July 29, 2014|df=mdy-all}}</ref> She was named one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]] magazine's'' 50 Most Beautiful People in 2003,<ref name="Collins2003">{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2003/04/30/entertainment/main551722.shtml|title=The (Most) Beautiful People Are Back!|last=Collins|first=Dan|date=April 30, 2003|accessdate=June 22, 2009|publisher=[[CBS News]]}}</ref> and continued as one of ''People'' magazine's [[People Magazine's 100 Most Beautiful People|100 Most Beautiful People]] in 2007, 2008, and 2009.<ref name="Ref_2007a">{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/htdocs/pdf/042507_people_list_facts.pdf|title=People 18th Annual Most Beautiful List|date=April 25, 2007|accessdate=June 26, 2009|publisher=[[CBS News]]|format=PDF}}</ref><ref name="Nichols2008">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2008/04/30/people-beautiful-ents-dc-idUSN3051362720080501|title=Kate Hudson Among People Magazine's Most Beautiful|last=Nichols|first=Michelle|date=April 30, 2008|accessdate=June 22, 2009|archive-url=https://archive.is/20170820090451/http://www.reuters.com/article/people-beautiful-ents-dc-idUSN3051362720080430|archive-date=August 20, 2017|dead-url=no|publisher=Reuters|department=Life|df=mdy-all}}{{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6i2oKdth4?url=http://www.reuters.com/article/people-beautiful-ents-dc-idUSN3051362720080501|date=June 5, 2016|format=addlarchives}}</ref><ref name="Ref_2009e">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20277208,00.html|title=Pretty Funny|date=May 11, 2009|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref><ref name="Ref_2007b">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20062167,00.html|title=Not So Ugly Betties|date=May 7, 2007|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref> In 2007, Fey placed seventh on the Hot 100 List on [[AfterEllen.com and AfterElton.com|AfterEllen.com]].<ref name="Ref_2007c">{{cite news|url=http://www.afterellen.com/people/2007/6/hotlist|title=The 2007 AfterEllen.com Hot 100|date=June 7, 2007|accessdate=June 26, 2009|publisher=[[AfterEllen.com]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090710144000/http://www.afterellen.com/people/2007/6/hotlist|archivedate=July 10, 2009|df=mdy-all}}</ref> She repeated the appearance the following year, being voted as number one on the list.<ref name="Mucha2008">{{cite news|url=http://articles.philly.com/2008-06-09/news/24990338_1_lesbian-and-bisexual-women-sexiest-women-keeley-hazell|title=Upper Darby's Tina Fey sexiest, website says|last=Mucha|first=Peter|date=June 9, 2008|work=[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]]|accessdate=June 26, 2009}}</ref>
The newspaper editors and broadcast producers of the [[Associated Press]] voted Fey the AP Entertainer of the Year as the performer who had the greatest impact on culture and entertainment in 2008, citing her impression of Sarah Palin on ''SNL''.<ref name="san fran">{{cite news |url= http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article/article?f=/c/a/2008/12/23/DDAS14U0BA.DTL|title=AP names Tina Fey entertainer of the year|accessdate=December 30, 2009|date=December 23, 2008|agency=Associated Press|work=San Francisco Chronicle}}</ref> She has appeared on ''[[Forbes]]''<nowiki>'</nowiki> annual [[Celebrity 100]] list of the 100 most powerful celebrities in 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, and 2012 at No. 99, No. 86, No. 90, No. 92, and No. 79 respectively.<ref name="Wasden2008">{{cite web|url=http://www.forbesinc.com/newsroom/releases/editorial/ForbesCeleb063008.pdf|title=Oprah tops Forbes' Celebrity 100 Power List for 2nd straight year|last=Wasden|first=Elizabeth|author2=Helaina Rosenthal|date=June 11, 2008|work=[[Forbes]]|accessdate=June 26, 2009|format=PDF|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5lj3dAU9o?url=http://www.forbesinc.com/newsroom/releases/editorial/ForbesCeleb063008.pdf|archivedate=December 2, 2009|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="Ref_2009f">{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2009/53/celebrity-09_Tina-Fey_HES3.html |title=The 2009 Celebrity 100|date=June 3, 2009|work=[[Forbes]]|accessdate=June 26, 2009}}</ref><ref name="Ref_2010">{{cite news |url= https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/53/celeb-100-10_Tina-Fey_HES3.html|title=#90 Tina Fey|accessdate=June 29, 2010|date=June 28, 2010|work=Forbes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2012/celebrities/celebrity-100_2011.html |title=Celebrity 100 2011 |accessdate=May 14, 2014 |work=[[Forbes]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/celebrities/list/ |title=The World's Most Powerful Celebrities | work=[[Forbes]] |date=June 2013 |accessdate=May 14, 2014}}</ref>
In 2007, the ''[[New York Post]]'' included Fey in New York's 50 Most Powerful Women, ranking her at number 33.<ref name="Standtmiller2007">{{cite journal|first=Mandy|last=Standtmiller|title=Meet Gotham's Leading Ladies — New York's 50 Most Powerful Women|date=May 13, 2007|work=[[New York Post]]|page=020}}</ref> Fey was among the [[Time 100]], a list of the 100 most influential people in the world, in 2007 and 2009, as selected annually by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine.<ref name="Poniewozik2007">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/2007/time100/article/0,28804,1595326_1595332,00.html|title=Tina Fey|last=Poniewozik|first=James|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009 | date=May 3, 2007}}</ref><ref name="time 2009">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1894410_1893836_1893831,00.html|title=Tina Fey|last=Baldwin|first=Alec|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009 | date=April 30, 2009}}</ref> Fey's featured article for the 2009 list was written by ''30 Rock'' co-star, [[Alec Baldwin]].<ref name="time 2009" /> She was selected by [[Barbara Walters]] as one of America's 10 Most Fascinating People of 2008.<ref name="Dimond2008">{{cite news|first=Anna|last=Dimond|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Barbara-Walters-Special-1000398.aspx|title=Barbara Walters Gets Up Close with 2008's Most Fascinating People|work=[[TV Guide]]|accessdate=December 3, 2008|date=December 1, 2008}}</ref>
In September 2011, Fey was ranked at the top of Forbes magazine's list of the highest-paid TV actresses.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiavision.com/news/article/entertainment/233964/eva-longoria-marcia-cross-top-forbes-list-of-highestpaid-tv-actresses/|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130103075304/http://www.indiavision.com/news/article/entertainment/233964/eva-longoria-marcia-cross-top-forbes-list-of-highestpaid-tv-actresses/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=January 3, 2013|title=Eva Longoria, Marcia Cross top Forbes' list of highest-paid TV actresses|date=September 29, 2011|publisher=Indiavision news}}</ref>
In June 2010, it was announced Fey would receive a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in 2011.<ref name="Schneider2010">{{cite news|first=Michael|last=Schneider|url=http://weblogs.variety.com/on_the_air/2010/06/oprah-neil-patrick-harris-tina-fey-to-get-hollywood-walk-of-fame-stars.html|title=Oprah, Neil Patrick Harris, Tina Fey to get Hollywood Walk of Fame stars|accessdate=October 25, 2010|date=June 17, 2010|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100620180933/http://weblogs.variety.com/on_the_air/2010/06/oprah-neil-patrick-harris-tina-fey-to-get-hollywood-walk-of-fame-stars.html|archivedate=June 20, 2010|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In 2014, Fey was recognized by ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]] magazine'' during The Women in Hollywood Awards, honoring women for their outstanding achievements in film, spanning all aspects of the motion picture industry, including acting, directing, and producing.<ref>{{cite web|last=Matthews |first=Natalie |url=http://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/g8789/women-in-hollywood-2014/ |title=Women in Hollywood 2014 – ELLE November 2014 Cover Story |publisher=Elle.com |date= |accessdate=January 30, 2016}}</ref>
==Charity work== Fey's charity work includes support of [[Autism Speaks]], an organization that sponsors [[Autism spectrum|autism]] research.<ref name="Ref_g">{{cite web|url=http://www.autismspeaks.org/sponsoredevents/index.php|title=Upcoming Sponsored Events|publisher=Autism Speaks|accessdate=September 15, 2009}}</ref><ref name="Ref_2007d">{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/redcarpet2007/article/0,,20006775_20008589,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070120065537/http://www.people.com/people/package/redcarpet2007/article/0%2C%2C20006775_20008589%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=January 20, 2007 |title=Burning Questions: What Is the Jigsaw Piece Everyone Is Wearing? |date=January 15, 2007 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |accessdate=June 7, 2009 |df= }}</ref> In April 2008, she participated in ''Night of Too Many Stars'', a comedy benefit show for autism education.<ref name="Freydkin2008a">{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2008-04-13-too-many-stars_N.htm|title=Comedians get serious in fundraising for autism |last=Freydkin |first=Donna|date=April 13, 2008|work=[[USA Today]]|accessdate=June 7, 2009}}</ref>
Fey is also a supporter of [[Mercy Corps]], a global relief and development organization, in their campaign to end world hunger.<ref name="Mercy2008">{{cite press release|title=Tina Fey, Ann Curry, Nic Robertson Fight World Hunger; Lend Voices to Mercy Corps Action Center Interactive Exhibit|publisher=Mercy Corps|date=September 17, 2008|url=http://www.mercycorps.org/pressreleases/14343|accessdate=September 16, 2009 |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/5nUZqPohO?url=http://www.mercycorps.org/pressreleases/14343|archivedate=February 12, 2010}}</ref> Fey narrated a video for Mercy Corps's Action Center in New York City, describing hunger as a symptom of many wider world problems.<ref name="Hajela2008">{{cite news|url=http://www.mercycorps.org/inthenews/14349|title=AP: Center Opens in NYC to Fight Global Hunger|last=Hajela|first=Deepti|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=Mercy Corps|accessdate=June 7, 2009 |date=October 15, 2008|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5nUa4j0QG?url=http://www.mercycorps.org/inthenews/14349|archivedate=February 12, 2010}}</ref> She also supports the Love Our Children USA organization, which fights violence against children,<ref name="Madigan2009">{{cite news|first=Nick|last=Madigan|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118009088.html?categoryid=1236&cs=1|title=Fey's take on Palin earns her an Emmy|accessdate=February 12, 2010|date=September 23, 2009|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]}}</ref> who named her among their Mothers Who Make a Difference, in 2009.<ref name="Ordona2010">{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ordoña|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2010/04/02/PKRJ1CMTEH.DTL|title=Fey, Carell share laughs in 'Date Night' |accessdate=April 3, 2010|date=April 2, 2010|work=San Francisco Chronicle}}</ref> She was the 2009 national spokesperson for the [[Light the Night Walk]], which benefits the [[Leukemia & Lymphoma Society]].<ref name="Ref_2009g">{{cite web|title=Tina Fey: 2009 Light the Night Walk National Spokesperson|url=http://www.leukemia-lymphoma.org/eMarketing/eNewsArchives/eNewsline/2009/March.htm|work=eNewsline|publisher=Leukemia & Lymphoma Society|date=March 2009|accessdate=September 15, 2009|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5nUaDeJsW?url=http://www.leukemia-lymphoma.org/eMarketing/eNewsArchives/eNewsline/2009/March.htm|archivedate=February 12, 2010}}</ref>
Fey has granted wishes for The [[Make-A-Wish Foundation]] and hosted the 2018 Power of a Wish Gala in New York City.<ref>{{cite web|title=Power of a Wish Gala|url=http://metrony.wish.org/news-and-events/calendar-of-events/events-time-folder/2018/metro-gala-2018|website=Make-A-Wish Foundation|accessdate=July 20, 2018|language=en|}}</ref>
==Personal life== [[File:TinaFeyJeffRichmondApr10.jpg|thumb|upright|Fey with husband [[Jeff Richmond]] at the premiere of ''[[Date Night]]'' in April 2010]]
In 1994, two years after Fey joined Chicago's [[The Second City|Second City]] improvisational theatre troupe, she began dating [[Jeff Richmond]], a pianist who later became Second City's musical director and then a composer on ''30 Rock''. They married in a [[Greek Orthodox]] ceremony on June 3, 2001.<ref name="PeopleBio">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/tina_fey/biography/0,,20227947,00.html|title=Tina Fey Biography|last=Mock|first=Janet|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|page=1|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref> They have two daughters: Alice Zenobia Richmond (born September 10, 2005)<ref name="Reardanz2005">{{cite news|title='SNL' Star Tina Fey Gives Birth to Girl|agency=[[Associated Press]] |work= [[San Francisco Chronicle]]|accessdate=November 17, 2007|date=October 1, 2005|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/dailydish/detail?entry_id=786 | first=Karen | last=Reardanz}}</ref> and Penelope Athena Richmond (born August 10, 2011).<ref name="People2011">{{cite news |title=Tina Fey Welcomes Daughter Penelope Athena|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|accessdate=August 12, 2011|date=August 12, 2011 |url= http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20518167,00.html | first=Sara | last=Hammel}}</ref><ref name="Peterson2005">{{cite news |url= http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1121226,00.html |title=''SNL's'' Tina Fey Back From Maternity Leave|last=Peterson|first=Todd|date=October 21, 2005|work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |accessdate=July 9, 2009}}</ref> In April 2009, Fey and Richmond purchased a US$3.4 million apartment on the [[Upper West Side]] in New York City.<ref name="Rovzar2009">{{cite news|url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2009/04/tina_fey_upgrades_on_west_end.html |title=Tina Fey Upgrades on West End Avenue|last=Rovzar|first=Chris|date=April 21, 2009|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref>
Fey has a scar a few inches long on the left side of her chin and cheek, the cause of which remained unexplained to the public until a 2009 ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' profile by [[Maureen Dowd]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Dowd|first=Maureen|title=What Tina Wants|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120818112826/http://www.vanityfair.com/magazine/2009/01/tina_fey200901|archivedate=August 18, 2012|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/magazine/2009/01/tina_fey200901|work=VanityFair.com|publisher=Vanity Fair (Condé Nast Publications)|accessdate=January 12, 2012|date=January 2009 |quote=... a faint scar runs across Tina Fey's left cheek, the result of a violent cutting attack by a stranger when Fey was five. Her husband says, "It was in, like, the front yard of her house, and somebody who just came up, and she just thought somebody marked her with a pen." ...}}</ref> and subsequently in her autobiographical book, where she revealed that "during the spring semester of kindergarten, I was [[Slashing (crime)|slashed]] in the face by a stranger in the alley behind my house."<ref>''Bossypants'', p. 8</ref>

==Awards and nominations== {{main article|List of awards and nominations received by Tina Fey}} Among her numerous accolades, Fey has won nine [[Primetime Emmy Award]]s, three [[Golden Globes]], five [[Screen Actors Guild Award]]s, seven [[Writers Guild Award]]s, three [[Producers Guild Award]]s, and has been nominated for a [[Grammy Award]]. In 2010, Fey was awarded the [[Mark Twain Prize for American Humor]], becoming the youngest-ever recipient of the award,<ref name="Levy2010" /> and it was announced that she would receive a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in 2011.<ref name="Schneider2010" /> In 2018, Fey received the Herb Sargent Award for Comedy Excellence from the [[Writers Guild of America]] together with frequent collaborator [[Robert Carlock]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=McNary|first1=Dave|title=Tina Fey, Robert Carlock to Be Honored by Writers Guild of America East|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/tina-fey-robert-carlock-writers-guild-honor-1202640855/|accessdate=February 17, 2018|work=Variety|date=December 14, 2017}}</ref> In 2018, Fey received her first [[Tony Award]] nomination, for [[Tony Award for Best Book of a Musical|Best Book of a Musical]] for ''[[Mean Girls (musical)|Mean Girls]]''.
